intro: Lophiolepis sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis' lophiolepis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
